text: @all please how i can dnd section on full width in HubSpot boilerplate

Sorry I’m so late to this you guys. We did hide it originally and got a lot of questions about it coming through support. Our UX rules tend to be that if something isn’t available, it should show as disabled so that we can tell the end user why they don’t have access to it. That being said, we can probably do a better job of explaining in that message--I can definitely look into that :slightly_smiling_face:
And soon you _will_ be able to set style options for custom modules!

Is this a bug? :slightly_smiling_face: I have an old page that uses an <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-templates|old school drag and drop template from the legacy design manager>, and I am trying to swap the page's template to a coded template that uses the new `dnd` areas. However, the coded `dnd` templates don't show up in the "Select template" dialogue, so I'm unable to upgrade this page to use the new template :thinking_face:

The coded dnd templates have `isAvailableForNewContent` set to `true` so that shouldn't be the issue.

By the way, I noticed a similar problem when I was swapping template on a page that used a coded template in which there was only a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#flexible-column|flexible column>. The new `dnd` templates didn't show up in the template swap dialogue, but in that case I was able to work around it by adding a flexible column to my new `dnd` template, which made it show up in the dialogue.

Hey Thomas! Right now, content can only be swapped to other templates of the same type (i.e. an old legacy template can only be swapped to a legacy template, and a coded file with DND area can only be swapped to another coded file with DND area). My team is working on a fix for this though, if you'd like to be a part of the beta group just let me or <@ULCSUPTGU> know!
